meanings.definition: A person sent or authorized to represent others, especially at a conference or meeting.
meanings.sent1: The delegates from different countries gathered to discuss important issues.
meanings.sent2: The delegates voted on the new policy during the conference.
meanings.sent3: The delegates had a lively debate about the best approach to solving the problem.
meanings.sent4: She was like a delegate of peace, spreading harmony wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The delegates wore matching badges to show their unity.

meanings.definition: To entrust a task or responsibility to another person.
meanings.sent1: He delegates the project to his capable team members.
meanings.sent2: She always delegates the difficult tasks to her assistant.
meanings.sent3: The boss decided to delegate the presentation to the new employee for practice.
meanings.sent4: Delegating tasks effectively can lead to better time management.
meanings.sent5: The teacher delegates different roles to students for group projects.

meanings.definition: To assign or transfer power or authority to someone else.
meanings.sent1: The manager delegates decision-making authority to his team leaders.
meanings.sent2: The president delegates certain responsibilities to the vice president.
meanings.sent3: The king jokingly delegates his royal duties to his pet cat.
meanings.sent4: She delegates the responsibility of organizing the event to her friend.
meanings.sent5: Delegating authority can empower others to take initiative.
